CSSGrid-area.summary: The grid-area CSS shorthand property specifies a grid item's size and location within a grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the edges of its grid areas.

remarks.para: If four <grid-line> values are specified, grid-row-start is set to the first value, grid-column-start is set to the second value, grid-row-end is set to the third value, and grid-column-end is set to the fourth value.
When grid-column-end is omitted, if grid-column-start is a {{cssxref("<custom-ident>")}}, grid-column-end is set to that <custom-ident>; otherwise, it is set to auto.
When grid-row-end is omitted, if grid-row-start is a <custom-ident>, grid-row-end is set to that <custom-ident>; otherwise, it is set to auto.
When grid-column-start is omitted, if grid-row-start is a <custom-ident>, all four longhands are set to that value. Otherwise, it is set to auto.
The grid-area property can also be set to a {{cssxref("<custom-ident>")}} which acts as a name for the area, which can then be placed using grid-template-areas.
